intro: Thlaspi tenue, commonly known as slender cabbageworm, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tiny, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, typical of the mustard family. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and gardens. Thlaspi tenue is also known for its ability to tolerate poor soil conditions and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
